**Garbage and Costs**
Charging families for each bag of garbage they throw away sounds good for the environment and makes sense for money. But it may not be true. In many places, garbage collection is free. Families pay for this service through local taxes. A family that throws away a lot of garbage pays the same as a couple that throws away a little. But garbage disposal costs money. The more garbage people throw away, the more trucks and workers are needed. 
If garbage disposal is free, people will throw away too much garbage. A solution is to make families pay for the garbage they throw away. This can make them recycle more. Some American towns have started charging families for their garbage. They sell stickers that families put on their garbage bags. Only bags with these stickers are picked up.
In one town, Charlottesville, Virginia, families paid 80 cents for each sticker. This seemed like a good idea. But the study showed that the costs of the program were higher than the money made from stickers. The number of garbage bags did go down by 37%. But many people just put more garbage in each bag instead of buying more stickers. 
The weight of garbage collected only went down by 14%. In other towns without a charging system, the weight of garbage also went down a little. Some people even dumped their garbage illegally instead of paying for it. This illegal dumping might be a big part of the reason for less garbage collected.
One good thing was that recycling went up by 15%. This means people chose to recycle instead of paying to throw away their garbage. But many people were already recycling before the new charges.
A later study showed that charging for garbage does reduce the amount of garbage, but not by much. If prices go up by 10%, the amount of garbage only goes down by 0.3%. This is not a big change. To throw away much less garbage, people would need to buy less of everything. A small charge for garbage is not likely to change much.
In richer towns, people throw away more garbage than in poorer towns. They also have less time to recycle. So, charging families for garbage may not be a bad idea. But the effects of these policies can be complicated. Sometimes, it is hard to understand what will happen.

Theodore Zeldin talks about how work can change. Do you feel respected and appreciated at your job? Success is not enough anymore. Many people feel their work is not valued. Even famous people can feel unhappy. Loving your job used to be special, but now you should think about how your job affects you as a person. This is important. If your job makes you boring or too busy to think or be creative, then money and status will not make you happy.
I want to find out how work can help us feel fulfilled. Work should not just be about making money; it should help us live better lives and meet new people. But changing work will not end unemployment. Many educated people want jobs that are interesting and helpful.
Even jobs that used to be good, like being a doctor or an architect, can be stressful. Many workers feel unhappy and do not connect with their companies. In Britain, only 8% of workers feel their values match their company’s values.
I am studying different jobs to see how they affect people. I want to understand happiness, love, friendship, and respect. I am looking for better ways to earn a living. We need to think about who we are as people, not just about money.
Many hotel workers are very smart but have low pay and long hours. Hotels could be more than just places to sleep. They could be places where people from different countries meet and share experiences. Hotel workers could help guests learn about the city and each other. 
But hotels often focus only on making money. It is time to think about work in a new way. Work is about relationships. Many people want to feel independent at work. They should be able to choose their jobs and coworkers. 
Good communication is important, but it is not the same as real conversation. Real conversation helps us understand each other better and creates respect. When we have these conversations, we can change the world little by little. 
**Questions:**
1. Who is Theodore Zeldin?
2. What does Zeldin think about success at work?
3. Why is it important to think about how work affects us?
4. What do many hotel workers want?
5. How can hotels be better places for people?

Broadcasting**
Broadcasting means sending information, like words and pictures, to many people. The word "broadcast" comes from farming. It means to spread seeds widely. This idea is about growing and sharing things with many people.
When television was first made, it was thought of as a way to send information from one place to many homes. This was because of how society was changing. People wanted to get news and entertainment easily. 
In the 1930s, some people in Britain tried to make two-way television, like a video phone. They wanted to talk to each other using TV. Many people were excited and wrote about it in magazines. But big companies took control and made rules for TV. This made it hard for regular people to use their ideas.
In the USA, TV was mostly watched in public places, not at home. People went to see TV shows together. In Britain and Germany, many people also watched TV in public. 
As time went on, more people could buy TVs for their homes. This was because they had more money to spend. Families wanted to have fun and enjoy different shows at home. 
Broadcasting became a way for governments to share important news with everyone. It helped create a sense of community in the country. 
Today, broadcasting is changing again. New technology is making it different from before. The way we think about broadcasting might change too.

**Clutter**  
Sometimes, it feels like no matter how many things you have, you still do not feel safe. It is normal to want a home that is good for you, but sometimes we want too many things. Advertisements make us feel like we need more things. They tell us that if we do not have certain things, we are not good enough. Next time you walk down the street, try not to look at any ads. There are many ads everywhere: on TV, radio, newspapers, magazines, posters, t-shirts, and the internet. They all want us to buy more things.
**Caves**  
Many scientists study caves. They want to know where caves come from, how water works in caves, and what lives in them. Caves are interesting and make us curious. Many people study caves because they are important in nature. However, it can be hard to visit some caves, so many people who study caves are not just scientists but also people who visit caves for fun.
**Weather Watch**  
A long time ago, people started to study the weather just by watching it. Now, we have many tools like satellites and computers to help us understand the weather. These tools give us a lot of information very quickly. Sometimes, the words used to talk about the weather are very hard to understand. But our own experiences are still very important for making weather forecasts. What we see and feel can help scientists understand the weather better. 
---
**Questions:**
1. What do advertisements make us feel we need?
2. What do scientists study about caves?
3. How did people study the weather a long time ago?
4. What tools do we use today to help us understand the weather?
5. Why are our own experiences important for weather forecasts?

**MUSIC AND THEATRE**
I used to think that opera is mainly theatre. Now, I think it is more about music. I worked at a national opera house and learned that music is the most important part. I come from the world of theatre, where words and actors are very important. In theatre, the audience and the performers usually speak the same language.
At music performances, like concerts or operas, many people do not know much about music. Some feel embarrassed about this. Most people admire the performers. A good musician works very hard for many years. Watching great music is like watching a sports match. We know how to run, but we see that athletes are much better than us.
Theatre audiences have different expectations. They do not always understand how hard acting is. They may not be impressed when an actor says a long speech. People often ask actors, "How do you remember all those lines?" This does not mean that theatre audiences are easier or harder to please than music audiences. Many people enjoy both.
I think music can learn from theatre. A different approach can make the concert experience better. Live music is full of feelings and can connect with the audience. However, music performances often have strict rules, like dress codes, which can make the audience feel separate from the performers.
Sometimes, music audiences clap between songs, which can interrupt the performance. This is a way to show appreciation, but it can also break the flow of the music. 
Many people are working to bring new audiences to concerts and operas. They want to show that "serious" music is for everyone. I remember a special event called In Search of Angels. It took place in a cathedral and outside in the town. It was a great musical experience, and many audience members felt changed by it.
I wish music could be more like theatre, which can be exciting and different. Sometimes, using unusual places for performances can surprise both performers and audiences. It may not be comfortable, but theatre audiences are often brave and willing to try new things.
I know that many plays are done in a normal way, like concerts. But I believe we can change how people experience music. I love theatre and music, and I want more people to enjoy them too.

**Text:**
**Sand**  
I think sand is not very nice. It can be useful for making things like glass and concrete, but I don’t like it at the beach. Sand gets in my face and my food. It can hide important things like car keys and coins. When I am wet, sand sticks to me and is hard to wash off. But when I step on a towel or walk in a car, the sand falls off easily. Even after that, I find sand in my shoes and socks for days. I do not want sand!
**Lock and Key**  
People have always wanted a safe home. A long time ago, they used simple locks. Now, we have electronic locks that use cards. But many people still like to use a real key. They feel safer with a key. One company made a new electronic lock, but they also added a real metal key.
**Modern Art**  
I was nervous to visit the new Tate Modern gallery because I do not understand modern art. I like some art, like furry things and bright lights. I wish I knew more about it. The important thing is to enjoy the art, not to study it like a school essay. The gallery helps visitors understand the art better. They have good labels that explain what the art means. Now, I can understand the pictures more than before.

**Every Picture Tells a Story**
Making movies from books often means cutting parts of the story. This can be hard for the writer, but it can also help them see things in a new way. When I worked on a movie script, I saw that I could remove a lot of the dialogue and descriptions from the book and still tell the same story. This does not mean the original words were not important. In books, some details are repeated to help readers remember characters. In movies, we can often tell who is speaking by how the scene looks and sounds, but names like "he said" help us understand better.
**Watching Movies**
When we watch movies, we can feel like we are part of the story. It takes us away from our everyday lives for a while. But when the movie ends, we go back to reality. Some people think movies are just for fun and not real art. Many older people, like our parents and teachers, enjoyed movies but did not see them as art.
**The Film Studios**
The Leiper Film Company studios had many different buildings. It was hard to find your way around because there were many small rooms that looked the same. There were three main entrances, but none of them helped you find your way easily. Most people who worked there knew how to get around, but it was confusing for new visitors. The workers helped create stories of love and adventure for people to enjoy.
**Film-Makers**
Many people want to make movies. There are many books about how to write scripts and make films. Some universities offer classes on this. There are also contests where you can win cameras to make your own films. Robert Rodriguez made a famous movie called El Mariachi for only $7,000. He became a well-known director quickly. He wrote in his book that he wanted to make a great film before he turned 26, like other famous directors did when they were young.
In the past, it took longer for directors to start making movies. They often worked in other jobs first, like editing or writing. For example, John Huston was 35 when he made his first film. Now, many new film-makers have to work alone without big studios to help them. 
---
**Questions:**
1. What does making movies from books often mean?
2. How do movies make us feel when we watch them?
3. How many main entrances did the Leiper Film Company studios have?
4. Who is Robert Rodriguez?
5. How old was John Huston when he made his first film?

In the past, there were many council houses on the west side of the city. These houses were small and not very nice. In summer, there was a bad smell from a factory nearby. In the morning, a paperboy often looked unhappy as he walked to deliver papers. I don’t remember much from my early life, but I do remember sitting by a window and looking at the houses far away. I also remember my mother. She was small and often angry. I didn’t understand why she was angry, so I couldn’t make her feel better. 
When I went with her to small shops or around the city, I noticed she was very alone, even in a crowd. She cared a lot about rules and how to behave. She often cleaned the house and told me to "behave properly." I didn’t understand her rules. They meant not going into neighbors' gardens and sitting quietly at the dinner table. 
My mother had some friends. There was Mrs. Buddery, who loved the Royal Family, Mrs. Winall, who didn’t say much, and Mrs. Laband, who was more lively. They talked about their problems, like bad legs and cold weather. I often felt like I was part of their talks about ungrateful children. 
Looking back, it felt like a heavy weight was on me, and I needed to grow up and get away from it. Growing up in West Earlham was very routine. Until I was five, I stayed at home. I remember long days playing on the floor while my mother sat in a chair. After I turned five, I went to school half a mile away. Some kids had mothers who rode bikes, but my mother let me go with other children.
I remember summer holidays when I saw a little of the world outside West Earlham. There was an old man next door who told stories about his life at sea. One time, there was a charity event where a kind woman gave out lemonade. She wanted me to join a group to help others, but my mother said no because she thought they just wanted money. My mother often talked about how people wanted money, and she didn’t like politicians.
My mother did care about my education. Sometimes, she took me to the Norwich Castle Museum on the bus. We looked at paintings together. My mother didn’t mind this, and she even started to have opinions about the art. I remember one time she saw a painting of a Roman soldier and said, "I wouldn’t want to meet him at night!" This was one of the few times she tried to make a joke. 
**Questions:**
1. Where were the council houses located?
2. What did the paperboy do in the morning?
3. How did the mother feel most of the time?
4. Who were the mother's friends?
5. What did the mother think about the charity event?

Philadelphia Avenue**
I walked down Philadelphia Avenue on the odd side of the street. It was getting dark, and the air felt wet and sticky. I knew this street well. I remembered my neighbors, the Matzes and the Pritchards, and Han Kieffer's grocery store. I played with girls who lived in the Kring's and the Pottses' houses.
The houses were different. Some were nice, and some were not as nice. Over the years, things changed. Some houses became stores, and some stores became homes. I wondered how people lived in these places.
**Bachelor Fads Furniture**
Rick Gilbert lives in a flat that used to be a curtain warehouse. His flat has big doors and brick walls. He did not want an empty space. He wanted to separate his living area from his work area. He used a big piece of plastic to make a hallway and hide his office. He wanted his kitchen to be a place where he could cook for friends or make coffee for clients. He put light wood on the floor and mixed modern furniture with old furniture from his parents.
**Bruce Chatwin**
Bruce Chatwin was a writer who loved to travel. His life was full of secrets and stories. His first book, *In Patagonia*, came out in 1977. It was a special travel book that told exciting stories. Sometimes, he changed facts to make his stories better. He believed that traveling could help people learn about history.
**Swimming**
One summer day, it rained a lot. I ran to the pool in my backyard. I swam and watched the raindrops make bubbles in the water. The best part was when the rain got stronger, and the sound of birds went away. That summer, I thought about swimming across Britain. I wanted to follow the rain to the sea. I felt tired of swimming in the same place. 
Many places today have signs and labels. This makes things feel less real. Walking, cycling, and swimming help us feel free and discover new things. A swimming journey would let me see parts of the world that are still mysterious.

CRYING**
Charles Darwin thought that crying did not have a clear purpose. He was probably wrong. Scientists now say that crying is important for social reasons. For example, psychiatrist John Bowlby said that crying helps mothers and children bond. Many people think that children cry because they feel helpless.
It is harder to understand why adults cry. The sound of crying is not as important as what we see when someone cries. In early human groups, crying may have helped people trust each other and feel close.
People cry for different reasons. We may cry when we feel sad for someone who is treated unfairly. Sometimes, we cry when we hear beautiful music or see a touching speech. We might also cry when we watch a sad movie, especially when we are with other people. 
Crying is important in social situations, and scientists are still studying it.

The Heat is On**
We all know about global warming. It means the Earth is getting warmer. But how much warmer will it get? And how will it change our lives? Many people have some idea about global warming, but they are not sure what will happen because of it.
A warmer Earth will change the weather everywhere. This will affect plants, animals, water, and soil. Humans use these natural resources to grow food, build cities, and live. If these resources change, it is a big problem.
In the last 100 years, human actions have made the air warmer by adding gases. These gases are connected to global warming. Scientists say that the Earth has warmed by about 6 degrees Celsius in the last century. They think this is not just natural and is partly because of pollution.
Scientists use computers to predict what will happen with the climate. They use special programs to look at temperature, pressure, and other factors. But these predictions are not always correct, and they can be slow and expensive.
Most people agree that climate change will happen faster than before. Predictions say that by the year 2100, the average temperature will go up by 1 to 3.5 degrees Celsius. The sea level will rise by 15 to 95 centimeters. There will also be more extreme weather, like heatwaves, floods, and droughts.
These changes can affect where plants and animals live. They can also change how we get food and water. Some areas may have big problems, but some changes might be good. For example, in Australia, wheat production has increased because of warmer temperatures.
However, small changes in climate can also cause water shortages. This is a big problem in dry areas. In places like the Mediterranean, there has been less rain in recent years.
Another problem is that glaciers are melting. This can change the environment and affect animals and people. The Arctic ice is melting, which can make it easier for ships to travel but also creates dangers.
The most serious effect of global warming is rising sea levels. Warmer water takes up more space, and melting ice adds to this. Many people live near the coast, so rising sea levels can cause flooding. Cities like London, New York, and Tokyo could be affected. Many people could lose their homes.
Small island countries are at the greatest risk. If sea levels rise too much, these islands could disappear. This would be a big loss for the people and their culture. It would also create many refugees who need new homes.

'Mission to Mars
Wanted: a married couple for a trip to Mars. The trip will take 501 days. The couple must be healthy and strong. This is for the first astronauts to go to Mars. Dennis Tito, a rich man, wants to send a spaceship on 5 January 2018. The spaceship will go to 160 km above Mars. It will use Mars' gravity to come back to Earth without using much fuel. This is important because the next time Mars and Earth are close is in 2031. 
It is a big job, and new technology is needed. If the technology is ready, the spaceship might go. Even if it does not go, the work will help for future trips to space.'

Aesthetics**
Art is important in our lives. It includes things like buildings, books, paintings, and statues. People often think of art as just these objects, but art is more than that. It is about how we feel and experience these objects.
Sometimes, people admire art so much that they forget how it connects to everyday life. When art becomes very famous, it can seem separate from the real world. This makes it hard to understand what art really means.
To understand art better, we need to look at our daily experiences. Just like mountains are part of the earth, art is part of our lives. We can enjoy flowers without knowing much about them, but to really understand them, we need to learn about how they grow.
Many people enjoy things like movies, music, and comics, but they do not always think of these as art. When art is only in museums, people may forget to enjoy the art around them in everyday life. 
To appreciate art, we should connect it to our daily experiences. When we see art in our lives, we can enjoy it more.

Observing Lions**
Lions are big cats that live in groups. They hunt together to find food. When the sun sets, lions quietly move to catch their prey. They work as a team to get their next meal. 
In 1978, researchers wanted to learn why lions hunt together, take care of their young, and scare away other animals with their loud roars. They thought that working together would help lions survive better. But they found out that sometimes, being too nice can be a problem. If one lion helps too much, it may not get enough food.
Lions are very good at resting and doing nothing. This made it hard for researchers to learn about their behavior. Lions can live for about 18 years, so it took a long time to find answers.

Advertising Problems**
If you work in advertising, the early 1990s were very hard. There was a big recession. This means that many businesses had problems. In Britain, in 1991, many people lost their jobs, and many homes were taken away because people could not pay for them. Many businesses, like car and building companies, lost a lot of money.
People in advertising also lost their jobs, but those who kept their jobs felt a lot of pressure. They had to do more work with less money. They were told to do better work with smaller budgets. At the same time, companies started to think more about what their customers wanted. They wanted to make products that people liked, not just what was easy for them to make.
Because of this, advertising became more important. Many companies started to pay more attention to advertising. They wanted to know if their advertising was working. They wanted to see results for the money they spent. But many companies were not sure if advertising was worth the money. They wanted better ideas and better advertising.
Even though advertising people were busy, they had to find ways to make good ads with less money. There were many challenges. Some were because of the recession, like high production costs. Others were changes in society, like new shopping habits and new laws about advertising. 
Now, more than ever, advertising people need to show that their ads work. But it is hard to find help or good information about how to make better ads. Many companies are too busy to talk about their problems. Those who are doing well often keep their success a secret. This means that there are not many good books or resources to help people in advertising. 
**Questions:**
1. What was hard for advertising workers in the early 1990s?
2. What happened to many people in Britain in 1991?
3. What did companies want to know about their advertising?
4. Why is it hard for advertising people to find help now?
5. What do many companies keep secret?

**The Kitchen**
When I was in university, I wanted to be a chef. This was not a common choice. Many people wanted different jobs. Being a chef is hard work. Chefs work long hours and do not earn much money. But I still wanted to be a chef. I was not happy at university. The work was difficult, and the people were not friendly. Cooking seemed like a good way to be happy. 
I remember the first time I ate at a famous restaurant in London. The food was amazing! I loved it so much that I wanted to learn how to cook like that. I started to read cookbooks and practice cooking. I wanted to be a chef more than anything else.
**The Swimming Instructor**
The swimming teacher was a small man with strong arms and tattoos. When I asked him to teach me how to dive, he told me to sit on the edge of the pool, put my hands above my head, and jump in. I practiced this until my time was up. The next time, he made me stand up and dive from the edge. He was strict and told me what to do: "Look up!" "Keep your legs straight!" 
One week, I went to the high diving board. It was very high! I felt scared but I tried to be brave. I jumped off and for a moment, I felt like I was flying. But when I hit the water, I fell awkwardly. The teacher looked unhappy, but I felt very happy. I understood what it means to be "free as a bird."
**The Traveller**
Some people love to travel. They like to explore new places and take risks. They climb high mountains and sail on the ocean. They eat strange food and live in different ways. Some people think these travelers are strange. They live in a world that is very different from ours. We like our comfortable homes and safe lives. 
**Sailing**
Jonathan Raban is a writer who is afraid of the sea, but he spends a lot of time on it. He is not the best sailor, but he knows how to sail. He likes to write about his sailing adventures. His small boat has a device that tells him where he is on the sea. 
Raban thinks that using a compass is not good. He believes it makes sailors forget to look at the waves and feel the sea. He thinks the ocean used to be full of life, but now it is just a big space. Because of this, a machine can help steer the boat, and sailors do not need to pay attention as much. This is why Raban has time to watch the waves carefully.

Holiday Reading**
Summer is a time for two great joys: going on holiday and reading books. These joys are connected. Books can help us feel at home in the world. We can see our own experiences in the stories of others. Authors use words to describe feelings and situations that we may think we are alone in. They can express our thoughts clearly, helping us understand ourselves better. 
When we read a good book or travel to a new place, we see things differently. At first, we notice many details, like the colors of the sky or the expressions on people's faces. We may even feel emotions we didn’t know we had before.
**Author's Note**
These thoughts about travel were published in the Observer newspaper over seven years. I made some small changes to fit the articles, but I kept most of the original text. Sometimes I corrected mistakes, but I did not change the main ideas. 
Traveling has changed a lot. Now, many people can travel anywhere with just a ticket. I believe that travelers are not blind to the world around them. Even a postcard can have a purpose.
**Ecotourism**
The word "ecotourism" is often used but not always correctly. It started in the 1980s when people became more aware of the environment. Tour operators saw that many travelers wanted to travel without harming nature. Now, "ecotourism" can mean many things, from living with remote tribes to short boat trips. Many tours that include nature or culture are called ecotourism. The original idea was good, but now it is confusing because there are no clear rules.
**Transylvanian Journey**
I lost my notebook about my trip to Transylvania for 50 years. I found it again a few years ago, and it helped me remember that time. In Transylvania, I had a great time, staying in friendly homes for weeks. I thought I had nothing to write about because I was enjoying myself. When I moved to a new place, I sometimes forgot to write. I worried that my notes were not in order, but I decided it was okay. I let the story tell itself without too many worries.

Fashion and Writing**
**Fashion**  
Fashion is often seen as something new. Many people think it started in the 1800s and 1900s. But fashion has a long history. Some historians say fashion began in the 1500s and 1600s when trade grew. As societies grew and changed, more types of clothes were made. This made the meaning of clothes more complex. For example, a man's suit can mean different things to different people.
**Writing**  
Many people think that all writers are famous and rich. But this is not true for most writers. Some writers have other jobs and write in the evenings. They need money to live. Others, like me, do different jobs, like teaching and writing articles. I have heard of a job in a chocolate factory for writing, but I never got that job. Still, I manage to write my novel by working part-time and using credit cards. 
**Sudden Fame**  
When we started performing, many people came to see us. We had to use secret doors to avoid fans. On days we did not work, it was hard to go outside without being followed by fans. In a few days, we became famous. Our fans watched us, and our managers took care of us. I felt shy, but I also felt a strange confidence. I was not used to this new life.

Music - The Future**
Technology is changing our lives. Susan Hallam talks about how this affects music in Britain. In the late 20th century, people had more ways to listen to music. They could use radio, TV, records, tapes, CDs, and videos. But, there are fewer live music performances and fewer jobs for musicians.
Many people believe that music will always be important. Music is part of big events in the country. It also helps people in many ways. A world without music is hard to imagine. The question is not if there will be music in the 21st century, but what kind of music it will be. 
The music industry is very important in Britain. It helps people get jobs, especially in media. Playing music can also help children learn better. Research shows that making music can help with thinking skills. Group music lessons can help children make friends and focus better in school.
Playing an instrument can help people learn good habits, like being on time and staying organized. Because of this, more people will want to learn instruments in the future. 
In the future, people will listen to many different kinds of music. New styles will mix together. Technology will also help people make music. This means that fewer live performances may happen, but more people will want to make music together in their communities.
To prepare for this future, music teachers need to change how they teach. They should help more people learn different instruments at all ages. Music education will need to include many skills. 
Musicians will need to learn how to teach and inspire people of all ages. They will also need to work well with different groups and learn how to manage community projects. This is a big change from how things are done now.
Finally, we need to show how important music is in our lives. Music is often taken for granted. Everyone in the music world should work together to make sure people understand its value.

**The Actor's Craft**
Sometimes, people do not like actors. This can happen when actors talk about their work in interviews. Instead of saying something interesting, they often use boring phrases or talk about gossip. 
An actor named Paul Scofield said that acting is special when it happens on stage. He believed that talking about acting makes it less interesting. Each time an actor performs, they start fresh and learn new things. After a play, they may feel empty until the next performance.
**A Review of Hamlet**
Adrian Lester plays Hamlet. He is a young man who is both a boy and a man. His performance is simple but very good. He shows a lot of control and confidence. Lester plays a young man who feels angry but also has a sense of humor. His acting is very impressive.
**What is Acting?**
Acting is about how people behave. It can be like copying someone or showing feelings. The big question is: what makes actors move and feel on stage?
**A Director's Rehearsal Process**
One director has a special way to start rehearsals called "dropping in." The stage manager shows the script on a screen. The actors listen quietly. When it is their turn to speak, they think about the words and what they mean. They wait for a feeling or idea before they speak. For example, if the line is about waiting in the rain, they might remember a time they waited in a line. This helps them find the right way to say the line.
**The Perfect Theatre**
A perfect theatre makes you feel important. When you go to see a play, it should feel special. The people who work at the theatre should care about the audience. The audience should be close enough to see and hear everything. The size of the theatre is important too. It should fit the actors and the audience well. 
Some old theatres are nice because they feel like they have history. When you go to the theatre, you want to see something new and surprising. If it is not surprising, you might as well stay home.

**Paul Simon**  
Rock and roll in the 1950s was music for young people. It was very important for many people, especially for the middle class. This music helped new rock stars to grow. They listened to this exciting music and knew it would change their lives. For Paul Simon and other young people in the US, the best way to hear this new music was from a radio show called Moondog Rock'n'Roll Party by Alan Freed. Many young rock stars listened to this show. Like John Lennon, who lived far away in Liverpool, Paul Simon loved the music from Freed's show. He wanted to go from just listening to music to making his own music.
**Snow**  
I could not see a path, but I thought I would be okay if I was careful. The wind was very strong, and it pushed me over on the ice. Suddenly, the snow under me broke, and I fell into a hole that was about four feet deep. The snow had covered a space between two rocks. I climbed out of the hole, feeling scared. I wondered what would happen if the hole was much deeper. I sat against a pine tree that was sticking out of the snow to think. In one hour, I walked about half a mile. I knew I had to change my plan.
**Qualitative Research**  
There are many books that help researchers with qualitative research. These books talk a lot about collecting data, but they do not say much about how to analyze the data. Many people do not understand how researchers analyze their data. So, we asked different social scientists who have done qualitative research to talk about their methods. We wanted to share their ideas about analyzing data, not to make a guidebook for new researchers. This is not easy to do. We let our contributors share their work in different ways, like personal stories and more formal writing.

Screen Learning**
A few days ago, I saw my six-year-old son eating noodles in a funny way. He was pulling them up with his teeth and pretending to be a dinosaur. "I am a little dinosaur," he said. He was acting like a character from a TV show. I asked him what he knew about dinosaurs, but he did not know much.
Many people like to use the internet and computers for learning. But is learning from a screen good? One father tried an interactive program with his son. The father read the words while the son played with the pictures. The father thought that if his son had read a book for ten minutes, he might have learned something.
Research shows that children learn better when they talk with teachers or parents. Learning needs help from others. It is good to use new technology to teach our children, but traditional education is still very important.
**Hollywood**
By 1918, most movies in the world were made in Hollywood. People who lived there did not like this change. They thought Hollywood was becoming a bad place. But in the end, people liked the idea of success. Success means making a lot of money from movies.
Hollywood has changed a lot. It went from a small village to a famous town like New York or Paris. A long time ago, you could walk through orange trees to get to the store. Now, it is very different, but it still feels like a small village. People in Hollywood talk a lot about movies: how much money they make, who is dating who, and what projects they are working on. Many successful people want to live somewhere else but still work in Hollywood. It is a special place for everyone in show business.
**Photography**
Photography was created by artists in the 1800s. They wanted to keep a real record of what they saw. With new tools, they could make pictures that looked very real and detailed. This made other artists worried. They thought photography could not be real art because it used machines.
But photographers believed they had found a new way to express themselves. They used cameras like other artists use brushes and pencils to show the world and nature.
**Book Illustration**
In the past, every children's book had pictures. This was also true for many novels for older children. There were many children's books, but most were made with a small budget. Some work was not very good, but the best artists always did their best.
The collection of black-and-white illustrations is a mix of good and not-so-good work. It is a great place to find interesting things and learn about art. Some of these treasures will be shown to the public again, either through new books or exhibitions. There are signs that this is starting to happen, and soon, we may see classic children's book illustrations again.

Blogging: Sharing Online**
A long time ago, a website talked about the risks of telling people where you are online. When you say, "I am here," you are also telling many people about your life. Some of these people may not be nice. This shows that sharing a lot online can have problems.
Many people want to share their lives on the internet. They think it can bring them money or fame. But sometimes, sharing too much can be dangerous. In the past, some people, called bloggers, shared their lives online. They learned many lessons about sharing.
In January 1994, a 19-year-old student named Justin Hall started sharing his life on the web. At that time, the internet was new and mostly used by students and scientists. Hall wanted to share his story. He wrote a blog every day, and many people read it. He wrote about everything in his life.
One day, Hall had to stop his blog because he fell in love. His partner said he could not write about their relationship. Hall felt sad because sharing his life made people not trust him.
In 2002, a woman named Heather Armstrong had a blog called Dooce. She wrote about her job. One day, someone at her work sent her blog link to her bosses. Because of this, she lost her job. This shows that what we say online can affect our real lives.
Armstrong was sad but later got married and started her blog again. Now, she writes about her family and is very popular. She learned that we can say many things online, but we should be careful about what we share.

Enough Sleep?**
Many people today feel tired. In rich and busy countries, many people do not sleep well. In the USA, 40 million people have problems with sleep. Some books in Britain talk about people who cannot sleep. 
A sleep expert says, "People need more sleep." When people are busy, they sleep less. They wake up early to avoid traffic. 
One sleep expert did an experiment. He let people sleep for 14 hours a night for a month. After three weeks, they slept about 8 hours a night. This shows they needed more sleep.
In Europe, a university studies sleep. They look at how tiredness affects sailors and how noise at airports disturbs sleep. They also study how tired drivers can be dangerous. 
For their studies, they ask students to help. Students get paid £5 an hour. They change their sleep patterns based on instructions. Dr. Louise Reyner helps them feel safe. Some people worry because they wear special equipment on their heads. But the scientists are only looking at how the body works.
In a dark room, there is a driving simulator. The students come at 2 PM, a time when people often feel sleepy. They drive while answering questions. The road looks long and bright. 
The young men say they will not fall asleep. But Dr. Reyner has a video of one man trying to stay awake. At first, he sits up straight. Then, he starts to blink and nod off. He falls asleep for a few seconds and wakes up suddenly. The car goes off the road. 
Dr. Reyner says coffee can help. Two cups can keep you awake for a while. She suggests energy drinks and gum for alertness. 
Scientists know that humans sleep in cycles. When we sleep, we go through four stages, from light sleep to deep sleep. We dream during light sleep. Our body stays still to keep us safe. 
Scientists think sleep helps our bodies heal and rest. Women usually sleep longer than men. Older people need less sleep, but no one knows why. 
Some researchers say sleep helps us travel through time safely. In the past, people slept differently. A history professor found that in Britain from 1500 to 1850, people went to bed early, woke up after midnight, and then went back to sleep. This time was good for thinking and remembering dreams. 
By the 17th century, rich people started to sleep less and work more. The industrial revolution made people work longer hours. 
In some places in the world, people still do not have set bedtimes. They sleep for a few hours, then wake up. For some tribes, noise and the need to watch for danger make it hard to sleep all night. 
It seems that people everywhere need more sleep.

I am wearing big cowboy boots. They cost a lot of money. I am standing on rocks in the Arizona desert. I have a cowboy outfit, but I am not a cowboy. I look at the mountains and feel out of place. I flew in from Denver early in the morning. I thought I looked like a cowboy, but then I saw a real cowboy at the airport. He looked very different from me. 
I used to be a racing driver. I loved it. But now I do not race anymore. I wonder what I can do now. I thought I could be a commentator for races, but many people want that job. I also thought about selling classic cars, but that did not work out. 
Being an "ex" is hard. People do not want to hear about my past. They do not want to hear that I was almost a champion. I had a good time racing and made money, but I miss it. I miss the fast cars and the excitement. 
Now, I have a lot of free time. I looked at the blue sky. There were no big birds flying. I saw some small brown birds in a cactus. They seemed to want me to leave. I did not know there were songbirds in the desert. I realized that I have a lot to learn about being here. 
**Questions:**
1. What kind of boots is the person wearing?
2. Where is the person standing?
3. What did the person used to be?
4. What did the person think about being a commentator?
5. How does the person feel about their past?

Vancouver**
In the last ten years, many people from all over the world have moved to Vancouver, in western Canada. In the evening, people walk in the city streets. If you walk with them, you can hear many different languages. People come to Vancouver because it has nice weather, beautiful views of the ocean and mountains, a clean and safe place to live, and good schools and jobs. Some people do not like how fast new buildings are being built, but many agree that new people and tourists have helped the city grow. 
**

**Citizen Kane**  
The film *Citizen Kane* came out in 1941. Many people talked about it, but it did not make a lot of money at first. Later, it became popular again on television. This film inspired many people to make their own films. This is surprising because it was Orson Welles's first film. Welles said that he did not know what he could or could not do, so he just made the film his way. He had a great team with him, including cameraman Gregg Toland and screenwriter Herman J. Mankiewicz. Welles and Mankiewicz had the idea to show a newspaper owner who was like Hearst. Welles thought this was a great chance for him as a director and actor.
**Dermot and Carmel**  
Dermot thought Carmel was a bit strange that morning. He said twice that he might be late and might stop at the golf club. He wanted to talk to someone there. Carmel nodded her head but seemed not to really hear him. He asked her, "Will you be okay? What will you do today?" She smiled and said, "Funny you ask. I have nothing to do, so I will walk downtown and look at the shops. I feel like it is a little wrong to waste the day." Dermot smiled back and said, "You should enjoy yourself. If I am late, I will not want to eat. So, don’t worry." She replied, "No, that’s fine."
**Job Titles**  
A recent study says that job titles can make people unhappy at work. A survey found that 90% of bosses and 70% of workers think titles create problems between colleagues. Most surprisingly, 70% of office workers would give up a pay rise for a better job title. People do not want to be called "subordinate" anymore. The titles people want sound nice (like "specialist" or "coordinator"), but they often mean the same thing.

**The Vienna Assignment**
I was in Vienna to take photographs. This was my job and my passion. I loved how light fell on things. A single picture could show a moment in time, a city, or a person. I always hoped to take the perfect photograph. I had my camera ready and kept looking for good shots.
Once, I took a picture of smoke from a burning oil well. It was a great photo, and many newspapers wanted it. After that, I worked for myself. I thought it was a smart choice, but life had other plans. The mid-nineties were not as successful as I hoped. That is why I was in Vienna, not somewhere more exciting. But I was still taking photographs, and I was getting paid. 
I got this job by chance. I had taken pictures in London for a book called "Four Cities in Four Seasons." The publishers liked my work. When the Austrian photographer, Rudi Schussner, left the job in Vienna, they asked me to take his place. I was happy to go because things were not good at home. A week in snowy Vienna sounded great.
I stayed at the Europa hotel in the old city. I had visited Vienna before with my wife, but it was a busy trip. This time, I was alone, and I felt it would be different. When I arrived, I saw the beautiful pink-grey dome over the snowy roofs. I was excited to take great pictures.
On my first day, I just rode the trams around the city. I wanted to feel the place. The weather was cold, and the city looked beautiful. I didn’t want to see what Rudi had done. This was going to be my Vienna.
A photograph is a moment in time. You have to wait for the right moment. So, I looked and waited. The next morning, I went out early. The snow made Stephansplatz look very pretty and quiet. I wanted to take a picture of the big cathedral, but it was hard to fit it all in one shot. It was tall and wide. I knew I would have to take a different kind of picture.
Photography is magical. You can watch a blank piece of paper turn into a photograph. Even when you understand how it works, it still feels mysterious. That morning at Stephansplatz, something surprising happened, but I was ready for it.

**Kinetic Art**
Good news! The Hayward Gallery in London is now a fun place to visit. It has a new exhibition about kinetic art. Kinetic art is art that moves or shows movement. This exhibition looks at kinetic art from the last 60 years. It shows that many artists have made moving art, even if people do not always notice it.
The exhibition has many paintings, drawings, documents, and films about kinetic art. The curator, Guy Brett, has studied this art for a long time. There are not many texts, so visitors can enjoy the art and make their own discoveries.
**David Hockney**
David Hockney is a popular artist. Many people like his work because it is easy to understand. His art often shows fun and relaxing moments. Some people like Hockney not just for his art but also for his funny personality. Some critics say Hockney is not a great artist. But others think he is good because he is popular. Hockney knows his art is not perfect, and he believes that only time will tell how good his work really is.
**Window-shopping - an Art Exhibition**
In the last few years, I have seen many art exhibitions. Some are great, and some are not so good. I do not like exhibitions that try to show a common idea among artists. Sometimes this works, but often it does not. So, I decided to create a different exhibition called "Window-shopping." 
I worked with seven artists in an empty warehouse. This exhibition showed different artworks that were connected only because they are all art. For example, Sam Cole made knitted cats that run around on a toy train track. Matthew Crawley made a video of him breaking a camera. These artworks are very different, but they can be together in one show.
**Art History**
Many people enjoy looking at paintings, but they may not want to think too much about them. Some art historians focus on theory and forget the joy of looking at art. This is like knowing how to cook a dish but not enjoying the taste. 
It is important to enjoy art, but knowing more about it can also make it more enjoyable. What we like about art can change over time and is influenced by our society. While feelings about art are important, thinking about art is also valuable.

Metals and St Ives**
**Metals**  
A long time ago, people in the Stone Age liked shiny things. One day, a person sat by a river and found a shiny yellow stone. It was not like other stones. This stone was gold. People liked gold because it was soft and easy to shape. They also found copper. They learned that copper could make strong tools. So, they started to look for copper and learned how to use it. 
**St Ives**  
We walked down a narrow, cobbled street to the town of St Ives. The wind was very strong, and the waves were big. There were no people outside, and all the windows were closed. We saw the weather get worse as we arrived on a small train. The sky was grey, and I thought visiting Cornwall without a car was not a good idea. I had told my friend we would walk by the beautiful coast and enjoy warm evenings by the fire.
**Computer Modelling**  
Studying the past is hard because it is gone. The people who lived long ago are not here now. We cannot see what they did or how they lived. Archaeology gives us some clues, but we cannot test our ideas with real experiments. However, we can use computer modelling. This means we can create pictures of old places and make virtual people. We can see how they might live and react to changes, like more rain or more people.

**Vervet Monkeys**  
Cheney and Seyfarth studied vervet monkeys. One day, the strong male monkey saw a strange male monkey near their trees. The strange monkey wanted to join their group. If he joined, the strong male could lose his place. To keep the strange monkey away, the strong male made a loud alarm call. This call means there is a leopard nearby. The strange monkey ran back to the trees. The strong male did this many times. But then, he made a mistake. He called out the alarm while walking across the ground. 
**Cats and Their Prey**  
In a village in England, people counted what their cats caught. In one year, seventy cats caught over 1,000 animals. A professor in America thought that all cats in Britain could catch 100 million birds and small animals each year! But this is not true. Most cats live in towns and catch fewer animals. The important question is: can the bird population survive? Yes, it can. In winter, people feed birds, and there are many places for birds to nest. So, cats are hunters, but they do not hurt the bird population too much.
**Buffalo's Day**  
Buffaloes are very important for the marshman. Every morning, the buffaloes leave their sleeping place slowly. They make sad sounds as they walk to the water. They stand at the edge for a long time, tired. Finally, the leader goes into the water. Once in the water, they relax and forget what they were doing. They swim slowly, looking tired. They spend the day in the reeds, eating green plants.
**Picasso**  
Pablo Picasso painted many things around him. In early spring 1940, he painted fish while in a fishing town. The painting shows a fish market with a crab and some fish on a scale. The fish look alive. The painting is hard to read because Picasso used a flat style with many colors. It looks calm, like underwater. But there is a feeling of danger because the fish look like they are fighting the crab. The painting shows both calmness and tension.

Photography**
Photography is a way to take pictures of people, places, and events. It has been around for about 180 years. People use photography to show many things in life. It helps us see moments that are quick and things that are very big or very small. We can see pictures from faraway places and learn about different cultures and problems in the world.
Before photography, people made pictures a long time ago. The first pictures were made about 35,000 years ago in caves. We do not know exactly why they made these pictures. They could have been for hunting, for religion, or just to make their homes look nice. Pictures have always been important in human culture.
When photography was invented in the 1800s, it was exciting. People thought it could show the truth. The camera works like our eyes and can take a picture of what we see. This made photography special because it could capture real moments.
Some people believe that everyone can understand photographs, no matter where they are from. For example, a person living far away could understand a picture of the sun and moon. But as the world changed, we started to wonder if everyone really sees photographs the same way.
Photography is often seen as a clear way to show reality. For example, when someone shows a picture and says, "This is my grandson," it feels very real. Since photography started in 1839, people’s ideas about it have changed a lot. 
At first, photographs were just for remembering things. Now, they are also important historical documents. They tell us about the people and the time when the picture was taken. 
Photography can also help bring change in society. For example, during the Italian Renaissance, new ways of seeing and making pictures changed art and culture. Today, photography is a big part of our media and helps us see the world’s problems.

**How to Write Poetry**
Writing poetry is fun, but it can be hard. It is important to read a lot and write a lot. This helps you think of new ideas. Some people write poems when they feel safe. Others write when they are sad. Some people write poems every day. Others wait for a good idea. All ways are good if they help you write.
**The Short Story**
In a short story, you should not have too many characters or too much detail. Flashbacks should be short and only used when needed. A flashback is when a character remembers something important. This can help the story move forward. Talking between characters is also important. It can show different sides of a story quickly. Too many words can make a short story boring. In a short story, every word should be important.
**Screenplays**
Writing a screenplay for a film is like playing chess. In chess, you make moves without knowing what will happen next. You learn to see the whole game, not just one move. The more you play chess, the better you understand it. Writing a screenplay is similar. You need to see the big picture and understand how the story works.
**Looking at Writing**
People naturally learn to speak, but writing is different. Children learn to talk without help, but they do not learn to write easily. Writing systems were created a long time ago and are not easy to learn. Many children today still find it hard to read and write. Writing is something we learn, while speaking is something we do naturally. We need to understand how writing works and how to help children learn it.

"I am writing a book. I feel unsure about it. I call it a novel, but I am not sure if it is really a novel. I do not have a big story to tell. There is no wedding or death in my story. I leave the reader wondering. This book is about a man I met many times, but I do not know much about his life. I could make up stories to fill in the gaps, but I do not want to do that. I just want to share what I know.
To protect people who are still alive, I have changed the names of the people in my story. The man I write about is not famous. Maybe he will never be famous. When he dies, he might not be remembered at all. My book may only be interesting for some people. But maybe his life and character will inspire others. After he is gone, people might see that he was special.
I think my book will help people who want to write about my friend. I do not say that my conversations are exact. I did not write down what was said, but I remember well. I have used my own words to tell what I think was said. Sometimes, I have imagined what people might have said to make the story more lively. I want people to enjoy reading my book.
Another reason I feel unsure is that the people in my story are from a different culture. It is hard to really know people from another country. People are shaped by where they are from, the games they played, the food they ate, and the schools they went to. You can only understand these things if you have lived them. Because I do not know these people well, it is hard to write about them in a believable way.
I usually write about people from my own country. If I write about others in short stories, it is easier because I can give quick details. In this book, I do not say that my characters see themselves the same way I see them. They are seen through my eyes."

**POETRY RECITALS**
Poetry recitals are events where people read poems aloud. Many people enjoy these events. There are different types of poets. Some poets write poems for books. They want people to read their poems on the page. Other poets like to perform their poems in front of an audience. They enjoy reading their poems out loud.
In the last twenty years, poetry readings have become more popular. Many places have these events. Small groups in towns hold poetry readings in community centers or homes. Schools invite poets to read to students. Arts festivals also have poetry readings with famous poets.
For poets who perform, reading their work to an audience is good. Their poems are often simple and easy to understand. People can enjoy them right away. But for poets who write complex poems, it can be harder. Many people may not understand their work if they hear it for the first time. These poets might choose to read their easiest poems, which may not show their best work.
Listening to poetry readings is fun and can help people understand poetry better. It is good to read the poems while listening or to know the poems before the reading. Poetry readings can help people enjoy poetry and see that it is for everyone, not just a few special people.

**Oral History**  
Oral history is when historians use stories from people to learn about the past. This can be hard because what someone remembers is not always true. When a historian talks to someone, both people can change how they feel and what they say. The historian chooses who to talk to and what to ask about. Even if the historian just listens, their presence can change the way the other person remembers things. The memories can also be affected by other things, like what people see on TV or how they feel about their past. Sometimes, people remember things differently because of their feelings now, not just what happened before.
**Animal Science**  
Animal science has two main ways to study animals: the body and the whole animal. Scientists who study the body look at how the body works, like how nerves and muscles help animals behave. Those who study the whole animal look at how animals act in their natural homes. There are two types of scientists in this area: psychologists and ethologists. Psychologists study how some animals, like rats and pigeons, learn in labs. Ethologists study how animals behave in the wild without learning. Both types of scientists are now working together more. It is important to study animal behavior in a way that makes sense, not just by looking at tiny parts of the body.
**The Social Sciences**  
When students start studying social sciences, they have to learn two things at once. They need to understand the subject and also how to study it. This means they learn not just facts but also how to find and organize information. Social sciences are about people and society, but they are more than just common sense. Each social science looks at different parts of social life and uses special methods to study them. These methods and ideas help scientists understand society better and make each subject unique.
**Classical Architecture**  
In ancient Greece and Rome, architecture was more than just building. The Roman architect Vitruvius said architecture is about order, arrangement, proportion, symmetry, and distribution. He did not talk about how useful a building is at first, but he later explained how to design buildings for different needs. The beginnings of classical architecture are complicated. Before the grand buildings, there were simple homes made of basic materials. These simple homes helped shape the later, more artistic buildings. Even though classical temples look fancy, they are based on simple, one-room huts.

Lily and her sister, Mui, kept a secret from Chen. Lily was learning to drive. She drove around the gardens and the train tracks. One time, she drove over a small bridge and bumped the car. Chen found out and was happy. He said, "You can drive, Lily! Good job!" Mui thought it was strange. Chen should be upset, but he was excited to make plans with Lily to go out driving. They chose a Monday next month. It was a quiet day, so they would leave early and come back by noon. Lily would practice driving before that.
Mui bought a road map. She got a discount, and Chen was impressed. But Lily felt bad because Mui did not trust her to find the way. Soon, they were at the beach. Lily drove very well. Mui sat in the back and watched. Chen even clapped for her. They drove past the gasworks and the lagoon with small boats. Lily parked the car in a quiet street. She was not sure about the parking signs, so she paid to avoid problems.
Lily locked the car doors. Chen joked, "No one will want this old car." The sisters were not happy. Lily told Chen he was ungrateful. Mui told him to be careful about what he said. Chen took their son, Man Kee, to see the sea. Man Kee was warm and soft. He put his little hand on Chen's sleeve. Chen thought about how to raise Man Kee. He wanted him to learn about business and own restaurants.
Chen looked at the sea and felt thoughtful. He saw smoke on the horizon and a ship. He used a telescope to look at it. At first, he could not find it, but then he did. It was a small, old ship. Chen lifted Man Kee to see. "Do you see the ship, Son?" he asked. "It is special for us. It will take us home one day." Chen kissed Man Kee's head. Lily and Mui came to see too. Man Kee did not want to give up the telescope. When he finally did, the ship was gone, and all Lily could see were seagulls flying.

**The Well**
I read that if you go deep enough into a hole, you can see the stars when it is clear. I asked you to help me with my idea. You watched me as I pulled up the well bucket. I climbed into the bucket and told you to let me down. I did not think about how heavy the bucket was or that you might not be strong enough. You held the handle while I pushed the bucket away from the wall. I fell into the well. I hit my head. At first, I saw strange lights. Later, I thought about how cartoon characters see stars when they hit their heads.
At first, I was confused, then scared, then relieved. I was also angry at you for letting me fall and worried about what my mother would say. You called down to me, asking if I was okay. I wanted to shout, but then I heard panic in your voice. I stayed quiet and watched you through my eyelashes. You ran away to get help. I waited a moment, then climbed back up and pulled myself out of the well. I landed on the ground and heard loud voices from the castle. I ran away to hide in the shadows.
My mother and father came with you and old Arthur. My mother was screaming. My father told Arthur to pull the winch handle. You looked pale and shocked. I was hiding in the shadows. I felt a strange happiness. Then I saw drops of water on the ground from my wet clothes. I looked in fear at the dark spots on the dry ground. I looked back at the courtyard where my father was shining a flashlight into the well. I could not believe no one saw the drops.
My mother was screaming loudly. I felt scared. I had played a trick on you, but now it was serious. I thought I would get in trouble. I wished I had thought more about my plan. I decided to come out of hiding. I stepped out and called out softly. When no one heard me, I yelled louder. I pretended to fall on the ground. I sat up and said I found a secret tunnel from the well to the moat. I said I crawled through it and came out.
I thought I was almost safe until my father came to me. He wanted me to tell my story again. I did, but I was nervous. He looked at me closely. I said the secret tunnel fell in after me and that the well was dangerous. I looked into my father's eyes, and it felt like he was seeing me for the first time. My words got stuck in my throat. 
“Don’t be ridiculous, boy,” he said. He walked away. Arthur looked at me with a sad face. He seemed worried about me because he knew I was lying. I felt bad about my lie and what my father thought of me.

**Removal Day**
Susan is a widow. Her children are now grown up. She is leaving her family home. A big van is outside. The van says, "Removers of Distinction." Susan sees that everything in her house is being taken away. Fred, the removal man, is packing her things. He is careful with the breakable items. 
Susan's house is very nice. It has four floors and looks at a small harbour. She remembers the years she spent there with her children. When they bought the house, her son Robert, who was five years old, asked, "Mum, how do you get a house home?" 
Now, Robert is helping her move. He is making sure they take care of the piano. Francesca, her daughter, is also helping. She thinks she is the best person to take care of the piano. 
Fred, the removal man, says, "She doesn't look like she's going to cry." Susan asks, "Do people cry?" Fred replies, "Yes, they do. They are happy while we work, but when they see the empty room, they cry." Susan understands this feeling.
The piano is very special. It is in the best room of the house. They will take it last. Susan remembers when they brought the piano into the house. It got stuck on the stairs. The removal men worked hard for two hours to get it in. Robert watched, and Francesca cried, "We can't live without a piano!" 
Peter, Susan's late husband, helped solve the problem. They took out a window and used a crane to bring the piano inside. The children were very happy to see it. 
Now, Susan thinks about how her children are busy and do not come home often. She feels tired going up the stairs. She worries about the piano. Fred asks her if she is okay. 
Susan looks around and feels sad. She thinks about all the things in the house. They are important to her. Just then, the piano comes down the stairs. Fred is careful with it. 
When the piano is outside, Robert laughs. Susan and Francesca start laughing too. They are happy it is all over. They walk down the path together for the last time, laughing and feeling good. Susan's tears are now tears of laughter.

**Online Book Reviews for Everyone**
Anyone can write book reviews on the Internet. This idea started when the Internet became popular. At first, it was hard for some people to publish their thoughts because they needed some technical skills. But then, Amazon.com, a big online bookstore, made it easy for everyone to write reviews about books.
On Amazon, anyone can write what they think about a book and give it up to five stars. Each book has its own page, and when someone writes a review, it appears right away. This helps other readers see what people think about the book, not just what the publisher says.
Amazon is very popular, and many people write reviews every day. Because there are so many reviews, Amazon cannot check all of them. They have a team that looks for bad reviews, like those with bad words or personal attacks on the author. But many reviews are anonymous, so it is hard to know who wrote them.
Some authors write good reviews for their own books. For example, a writer named Lev Grossman was upset about bad reviews for his first book. He wrote good reviews for his own book without saying who he was. Later, he told people he did this, and Amazon removed his fake reviews.
Authors can also write comments about their books on Amazon. Most of them write nice messages asking people to read their books. Some even give their email addresses for readers to contact them. However, Amazon does not always check if the comments are really from the authors.
Sometimes, readers write angry reviews. For example, when a book called "We've Got Spirit" was published, some people mentioned in the book were upset and wrote bad reviews. Many of these reviews disappeared after a few days. But Amazon liked that many people were writing reviews because it was good for business.
Most reviews on Amazon are serious. They help other readers decide if a book is good to buy. A famous writer, George Orwell, once said that writing too many reviews can be hard. But it is good that everyone can share their thoughts about books now.

**Art Today**
In modern times, many people think that artists must be different from other people. We say that art should be new and special. We like to admire artists whose work was not liked a long time ago. But when we see art today, we often say it is too strange or not real art. The media also say this, and many people agree. We expect art to be new and different, so we forget that today’s art has old ideas and styles too.
In the past, people asked artists to make art for special reasons. Art was part of everyday life. Now, artists work alone, and sometimes we get upset if they want to make art that is not serious.
**A Situation**
I will tell you a story and ask a question. An artist picks a text from an art book. The text talks about different pictures and says there are many kinds of pictures. Then, the artist asks someone to make a canvas for him. He tells a sign painter to write the text on the canvas in simple letters. The sign painter does this. My question is: is this finished work a painting?
**Art and Success**
In London, there is a rule for painters: if you find a style that sells well, you should keep using it. People who buy art want to see the same style again and again. Some artists, like Picasso and Hockney, try new things and still do well. Eric Rimmington is another artist who is trying something new. He is making paintings about the London Underground instead of his usual still lifes. He has made 40 paintings and drawings that show the interesting world under the city.
**A Story from an Island**
I have come to this island with some books. I do not know why I say "escape." The villagers joke that only a sick person would come to this quiet place. I am here to heal myself. I am alone except for an old woman who comes to clean my house. I feel neither happy nor sad; I feel like I am floating in my memories.
I talked about how art seems useless, but I did not say how it can help us. Art helps us see the world in a new way. In art, we can find joy and understand our lives better. Artists can show the beauty in life, even when life is hard. Why do we hurt each other if we can create and understand through art?

**Family Business**
"Look, this is not good!" said my Dad. We were in the car going back to London. My father, with my brother Maurice, had just picked me up from my school. I had just won two prizes: one for Latin and one for my exams. My father talked with my headteacher, and now we were going home for the holidays.
"What isn't good?" I asked, but I knew what he was thinking. My father usually talked a lot, but now he was quiet. "You can't trick me. You will do what you want now," he said. "You have all those certificates. I heard you will get a scholarship to Oxford."
"So?" I replied. "Isn't that good?" 
"I also heard you want to be a barrister," he said. "A barrister!" My father knew a lot about lawyers. 
"I just said that," I said. "I didn't know what else to say!" 
"And I heard you have the right personality. You can understand things quickly, you talk well, and you like to perform," he continued. 
"I don't know about that," I said. "I only know what I see on TV." 
"Anyway," he said, "I think you will not want to join the family business. You will go to Oxford, and after that, I don't think you will want to work with us." 
I felt trapped by what my family wanted. I saw many jobs I could do, and I wanted to explore them. But I didn't want to upset my father. I was not as scared of him as Maurice was - I was his favorite - but I still found him strong.
"It's too soon to know," I said weakly. 
"You will not want to join us," my father said. "It's a pity because you have the skills." 
"There's still Maurice," I said, unhappy. My father laughed. We both knew Maurice did not like the business. 
"Anyway," I said, "you could use me as a consultant." My mother was not around to help - she died when I was young, and my father raised me and Maurice. Maurice was two years younger than me, and I took care of him. I loved Maurice. 
Because the business was successful, we lived well - in a big house in London, good schools, nice clothes, and fun events. My father knew many people - politicians, actors, and businesspeople - and our house was always busy with interesting talks.
"I have an idea," my father said. "You can help us during the holidays until you leave Oxford. Then if you want to leave, you can. It will give you some money and help me." 
"OK," I said, happy to avoid making choices right now. I didn't want my father to be sad if I disagreed with him. This was how he controlled us. 
So, I helped out during my last term at school and during university vacations, but not too much. I became a smart student, with a small house, a nice car, and good clothes. 
In my last term, my father came to see me. He took me to a village for a meal and a talk. I had only a few weeks left. My teacher said I would get a First Class degree in Law, and I wanted to focus on my studies.
My father told me he needed me to do one last important job for the family business. "It is very important," he said. "I will make it worth your while."
"But Dad," I said, "I have my final exams soon. I need to focus on that. It is really important!" 
I could see my father did not understand my pressure. He would think I was being unkind if I said no. As he explained the job, I saw how focused he was on his work. He was very good at what he did, and I admired him. 
It made my own plans seem less important. "All right," I said. "I will do it."

Simon Costello bought a house in Pembroke Square with his wife, Lois. After one year, he thought it was a mistake. They needed to save money, but at first, the house seemed like a good idea. Simon had many successful cases at work, and Lois returned to her job after having twins. She earned thirty-five thousand dollars a year. Lois wanted to move because their flat was too small for their family. They needed more space, a garden, and a place for a helper. 
Lois wanted to live in a nice area. She thought Mornington Mansions was not good enough for them. Lois decided that one of them should take public transport to save money. Simon had to take the train because Lois's job was far away. The train was crowded, and Simon often felt unhappy during the ride. He remembered his grandfather's house, where he felt safe and happy as a child. His grandmother took care of his grandfather after work. 
Lois wanted her job to be as important as Simon's. They needed both of their salaries to pay for the house and their lifestyle. Simon was worried about a woman named Venetia. She was angry when she came to their office. Venetia said that a man named Brian Cartwright accused Simon of doing something wrong in a trial four years ago. She asked Simon if it was true. Simon said it was not true, but he felt guilty. 
He remembered feeling scared when he was a child and got in trouble. He looked into Venetia's eyes and saw that she did not believe him. He wished he had said something different. He thought he should have told her that Cartwright was lying. But he did not say that, and now he was worried about his job. He was not sure what Venetia could do, but he knew it could be very bad for him if people heard the rumors.

I chose this place to live because I thought I would be alone. I wanted to be with people who did not care about broken houses or messy gardens. But I was wrong. People in the shops see me, even if I do not see them. The flowers in my neighbor's garden remind me that gardens can be beautiful. 
I usually stay inside, but tonight I am watching the birds fly. I cut some plants to make space for a chair. My arms feel itchy from the plants. My garden is small, and the plants have to grow tall to live.
My neighbor, Jaz, is looking out of her window. She is a writer. I have her new story. "How is your writing, Jaz?" I ask. She says, "In my job, people always ask me questions." Then she says, "I have a drink in the fridge. I will bring it down." I do not want Jaz in my garden, and I see that it looks messy. Jaz knocks on my door.
